snippet.title: Adidas MiCoach Smart Run
snippet.description: The first high-end fitness watch from Adidas is packed full of features, but can it compete in a sea of wearable devices?

snippet.title: Paralyzed woman completes London Marathon in robot suit
snippet.description: A ReWalk robotic exoskeleton allows a paraplegic woman to start and finish the London Marathon, covering the 26.2-mile course over 17 days.

snippet.title: Want to run your first marathon? There's a watch for that.
snippet.description: The idea of running 26 miles can be daunting, especially if you're a beginning runner. But a slew of fitness trackers and GPS watches are helping people who have never run before get started and stay on track. CNET's Sumi Das shows us how the devices are motivating runners to finish their first marathons.

snippet.title: Why more people are training their cell phones on police
snippet.description: A police officer tries to stop a man washing his car in his own driveway. If it wasn't filmed on a smartphone, few would believe it.

snippet.title: Free tech training from the experts
snippet.description: New CNET members get 10 days of free software, creative, and business skills training at lynda.com.

snippet.title: Airbnb hires hotelier to lead host hospitality training
snippet.description: The company's new head of hospitality Chip Conley is known for his Joie de Vivre boutique hotels, and he wants to set new standards for Airbnb listings.

snippet.title: iPad pooches: Tablet training goes to the dogs
snippet.description: School for the Dogs' iPad-training classes are catching on as a novel way for humans to bond with their dogs, despite having to clean slobber off touch screens.

snippet.title: 14 days of free tech training from the experts
snippet.description: New CNET members get free software, creative, and business skills training at lynda.com.

snippet.title: Hong Kong marathon may ban cell phones, selfies
snippet.description: Race organizers are concerned after many smartphone-preoccupied participants in this year's race caused foot traffic accidents.

snippet.title: Pictures of the Week: Twitter, tech masterpieces, and training for space (slideshow)
snippet.description: Twitter goes public, India goes to Mars, and now you can train to be a space tourist -- these are the best pictures from the week in technology.
